title: Senior Staff Inbound Product Manager - AI Interoperability, Governance & Secure Agent Experiences
description:
Company Description


It all started in sunny San Diego, California in 2004 when a visionary engineer, Fred Luddy, saw the potential to transform how we work. Fast forward to today — ServiceNow stands as a global market leader, bringing innovative AI-enhanced technology to over 8,100 customers, including 85% of the Fortune 500®. Our intelligent cloud-based platform seamlessly connects people, systems, and processes to empower organizations to find smarter, faster, and better ways to work. But this is just the beginning of our journey. Join us as we pursue our purpose to make the world work better for everyone.


Job Description


What you get to do in this role:

Imagine leading the charge in next-generation AI interoperability and enterprise AI governance. In this role, you will define and deliver core capabilities within ServiceNow’s AI Control product—the platform that enables organizations to maintain security, privacy, monitoring, guardrails, and actionability across all AI usage.

You will be responsible for driving the evolution of ServiceNow’s AI governance layer, ensuring enterprises can safely adopt and scale AI through:

  • Strong security and privacy controls
  • Real-time monitoring and observability of AI interactions
  • Automated remediation and action workflows
  • Guardrails that enforce safe, compliant, policy-aligned AI behavior
  • Enterprise oversight across all AI agents, models, and integrations

This role places you at the center of AI transformation, defining how secure and governed connectivity works across AI agents, enterprise systems, and external platforms—leveraging emerging interoperability standards like Model Context Protocol (MCP) and Agent-to-Agent (A2A) frameworks.

You’ll partner closely with engineering, design, security, data governance, and AI/ML teams to deliver a unified platform experience where AI access governance, controls, and observability converge. You’ll also help shape industry standards by collaborating with leading partners and standards bodies.

If you want to shape the future of enterprise AI governance—this is your opportunity.


Qualifications


To be successful in this role, you have:

AI & Agent Ecosystem Expertise

  • Experience integrating AI into workflows, decision-making, or automation.
  • Strong understanding of AI-specific security, privacy, and governance risks, including model misuse, prompt injection, data leakage, and unsafe outputs.
  • Familiarity with MCP, A2A agent communication, agent lifecycle management, interoperability patterns, and orchestrated agent workflows.

Security, Privacy & Data Protections

  • Deep background in data security, including encryption, data access policies, safe data routing, personal data protections, and privacy-by-design.
  • Hands-on experience with designing AI access security controls, such as:
  • Role- and policy-based restrictions on AI usage
  • Guardrails and content safety filters
  • Monitoring and logging of AI interactions
  • Auditable decision trails and compliance reporting
  • Understanding of frameworks such as NIST, SOC 2, ISO 27001, GDPR, and how they influence enterprise AI governance.

Product Execution & Leadership

  • Proven product management experience (typically 9+ years) defining strategy, requirements, and roadmaps for complex enterprise or platform products.
  • Ability to write user stories, work closely with engineering, prioritize at scale, and drive execution end-to-end.
  • Experience collaborating with Security, Legal, AI/ML, Data Governance, Design, and Architecture teams.
    • Strong ability to think from both developer and admin perspectives—translating needs into secure, intuitive, compliant product capabilities.

AI UX/UI & Platform Experience

  • Experience shaping AI user experiences, including:
  • Interfaces for managing guardrails and access controls
  • AI monitoring dashboards and insights
  • Admin and developer-facing experiences for governing agents and models
  • Prior experience in SaaS, enterprise platform, or developer-oriented environments (no API-specific requirements).

Communication & Stakeholder Collaboration

  • Ability to communicate complex ideas clearly to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Strong customer empathy and curiosity—able to deeply understand problems and translate them into actionable product direction.
  • Excellent prioritization discipline, focusing on high-impact outcomes in fast-moving AI environments.


FD21

For positions in this location, we offer a base pay of $187,600 - $328,300, plus equity (when applicable), variable/incentive compensation and benefits. Sales positions generally offer a competitive On Target Earnings (OTE) incentive compensation structure. Please note that the base pay shown is a guideline, and individual total compensation will vary based on factors such as qualifications, skill level, competencies, and work location. We also offer health plans, including flexible spending accounts, a 401(k) Plan with company match, ESPP, matching donations, a flexible time away plan and family leave programs. Compensation is based on the geographic location in which the role is located and is subject to change based on work location.


Additional Information


Work Personas

We approach our distributed world of work with flexibility and trust. Work personas (flexible, remote, or required in office) are categories that are assigned to ServiceNow employees depending on the nature of their work and their assigned work location. Learn more here. To determine eligibility for a work persona, ServiceNow may confirm the distance between your primary residence and the closest ServiceNow office using a third-party service.

Equal Opportunity Employer

ServiceNow is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other category protected by law. In addition, all qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with legal requirements.

Accommodations

We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are unable to use this online application and need an alternative method to apply, please contact globaltalentss@servicenow.com for assistance.

Export Control Regulations

For positions requiring access to controlled technology subject to export control regulations, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may be required to obtain export control approval from government authorities for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by relevant export control authorities.

title: Manager, Corp Core AI Product
description:
Company Description


NBCUniversal is one of the world's leading media and entertainment companies. We create world-class content, which we distribute across our portfolio of film, television, and streaming, and bring to life through our theme parks and consumer experiences. We own and operate leading entertainment and news brands, including NBC, NBC News, MSNBC, CNBC, NBC Sports, Telemundo, NBC Local Stations, Bravo, USA Network, and Peacock, our premium ad-supported streaming service. We produce and distribute premier filmed entertainment and programming through Universal Filmed Entertainment Group and Universal Studio Group, and have world-renowned theme parks and attractions through Universal Destinations & Experiences. NBCUniversal is a subsidiary of Comcast Corporation.

Our impact is rooted in improving the communities where our employees, customers, and audiences live and work. We have a rich tradition of giving back and ensuring our employees have the opportunity to serve their communities. We champion an inclusive culture and strive to attract and develop a talented workforce to create and deliver a wide range of content reflecting our world.

Comcast NBCUniversal has announced its intent to create a new publicly traded company ('Versant') comprised of most of NBCUniversal's cable television networks, including USA Network, CNBC, MSNBC, Oxygen, E!, SYFY and Golf Channel along with complementary digital assets Fandango, Rotten Tomatoes, GolfNow, GolfPass, and SportsEngine. The well-capitalized company will have significant scale as a pure-play set of assets anchored by leading news, sports and entertainment content. The spin-off is expected to be completed during 2025.


Job Description


The Manager, Corp Core AI Product will lead a team of AI product managers and product owners supporting Finance, Source to Pay and HR business functions. This role is responsible for shaping the AI product strategy across these corporate domains, overseeing the intake and prioritization of use cases, and ensuring successful delivery of scalable, business-ready AI solutions. The manager partners closely with functional leaders and business engagement resources to understand business needs, translate them into AI opportunities, and drive measurable impact through automation, insights, and improved user experiences. This position also develops talent, establishes best practices for AI development, and fosters a culture of innovation, continuous learning, and operational excellence across the organization.


  • Team Leadership & Development

o Lead, mentor, and develop a high-performing team of AI product managers and product owners supporting Finance, S2P, and HR business functions.

o Foster a collaborative environment that encourages continuous learning and innovation in generative AI, automation, machine learning, LLM safety, prompt engineering, and enterprise data literacy.

o Foster a culture of operational excellence within the team.

o Mentor the team on product strategy, stakeholder management, and iterative delivery.

o Develop and coach team members, supporting their professional growth and skill advancement.

o Stay current on emerging AI capabilities, GenAI Platforms (e.g., SAP Business AI, Harvey AI, Azure OpenAI, Google Vertex AI, etc.)

o Champion a culture of new ideas and drive experimentation with prototypes, pilots, and proofs of concept.

  • AI Product Strategy & Roadmap

o Shape and execute the AI product strategy for core corporate functions.

o Define and maintain the product roadmap, aligning with business objectives and operational requirements.

o Oversee the intake, assessment, prioritization, and roadmap planning of AI use cases across Finance, Source to Pay, and HR.

o Ensure alignment of AI initiatives with enterprise strategy and corporate transformation objectives.

o Partner with business leaders to define problem statements, success metrics, ROI expectations, and long-term product vision.

o Evangelize AI enablement across corporate functions through demos, training, internal showcases, and value storytelling.

  • AI Solution Delivery

o Ensure the delivery of scalable, reliable, and impactful AI solutions.

o Guide the team through the end-to-end lifecycle of AI products and capabilities-from discovery and validation through design, development, testing, rollout, operational support, and KPIs.

o Remove roadblocks, allocate resources, and ensure execution quality across multiple business portfolios.

o Track delivery milestones, manage risks, and ensure adherence to responsible AI principles and regulatory guardrails.

o Drive cross-functional alignment with engineering, platform teams, cyber, legal, privacy and change management.

o Establish best practices for AI product development, including model evaluation, prompt management, data quality and post-launch monitoring.

  • Business Partnership

o Partner with business leaders to identify and translate operational needs into AI opportunities.

o Serve as a subject matter expert, guiding stakeholders on AI capabilities and best practices.


Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in a relevant field (e.g., Computer Science, Data Analytics, Business, or related discipline).
  • 7+ years of experience in product management, with at least 3 years in AI or data-driven product roles.
  • 2+ years of people management experience
  • Proven experience leading teams and managing cross-functional AI initiatives.
  • Hands-on experience with AI/ML, automation, analytics, and data-driven product development.
  • Demonstrated ability to partner with business leaders and translate needs into technical solutions.
  • Excellent communication, leadership, and stakeholder management skills.
  • Experience in Finance, Source to Pay, or HR domains is highly desirable.
  • Familiarity with cloud platforms, analytics tools, and agile methodologies.
  • Demonstrate excellent verbal/presentation and written communication skills
  • Possess interpersonal skills to engage with all levels of Business and IT
  • Self-starter to work on multiple projects simultaneously with a keen desire to learn and expand depth of knowledge
  • Exhibit collaboration and teamwork skills
  • Willingness to work off business hours and weekends as needed in a demanding environment
  • Strong / effective influencing skills
  • Strong / effective problem-solving skills
  • Conceptual to detailed thinking skills
  • Deep understanding of data handling between applications
  • Quick learner capable of understanding new information, grasping concepts at a rapid pace
  • Ability to communicate at all levels with clarity and precision, both written and verbally, and tailor to audience to achieve desired results
  • Candidate should be an active learner that is detail oriented and a proven self-starter with the ability to multi-task, prioritize responsibilities, problem solve, work in a fast-paced and time-sensitive environment, and complete work timely and accurately


Preferred Characteristics

  • Experience with enterprise platforms such as SAP S/4, SAP Fieldglass or other ERP systems.
  • Knowledge of SAP modules and integrations is a plus.
  • Prior experience in corporate functions within a large matrixed organization.
  • Certification in Product Management, agile methodologies, or AI/ML (e.g., CSPO, PMAI, cloud AI certs).
  • Hands on experience with Enterprise AI / GenAI Platforms such as Azure OpenAI, SAP Business AI, Google Vertex, Amazon Bedrock, Microsoft Copilot Studio
  • Experience with prompt design and evaluation tools across LLM platforms
  • Model Development / ML Ops experience

Additional Information


As part of our selection process, external candidates may be required to attend an in-person interview with an NBCUniversal employee at one of our locations prior to a hiring decision. NBCUniversal's policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, gender identity or expression, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, membership in the uniformed services, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law.

If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you have the right to request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access nbcunicareers.com as a result of your disability. You can request reasonable accommodations by emailing AccessibilitySupport@nbcuni.com.

For LA County and City Residents Only: NBCUniversal will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories, or arrest or conviction records, in a manner consistent with relevant legal requirements, including the City of Los Angeles' Fair Chance Initiative For Hiring Ordinance, the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers, and the California Fair Chance Act, where applicable.

title: Techno-Functional Consultant â€“ Product Life Cycle Management (PLM)
description:
Job Description

About the Role: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced PLM Techno-Functional Consultant. The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing the end-to-end PLM system lifecycle, including configuration, customization, and integration with other enterprise systems.
Key Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand requirements and translate them into PLM system configurations and customizations.
  • Lead system integration initiatives between PLM and other enterprise systems (e.g., ERP, CRM).
  • Develop and maintain technical documentation, including system design, architecture, and user manuals.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to PLM systems.
  • Conduct system testing, validation, and performance tuning.
  • Provide end-user support and training on PLM functionalities and best practices.
  • Ensure compliance with data governance and security standards.
  • Stay updated with the latest PLM technologies and trends to recommend improvements and innovations.

Qualifications and Skills:

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a related field.
  • 15+ years of Proven experience in implementing and managing PLM systems (e.g., Siemens Teamcenter)
  • Strong understanding of product data management (PDM) and product lifecycle processes.
  • 2+ year of Hands-on experience with PLM system configuration, customization, and scripting.
  • Knowledge of integration technologies (e.g., APIs, middleware) and experience with ERP systems.
  • Proficiency in programming languages such as Java, Python, or C++.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Worked with Siemens Teamcenter, and any certification.
  • Experience in Agile or Scrum development methodologies.
  • Familiarity with cloud-based PLM solutions.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $130,695.78 - $150,000.00 per year

Work Location: In person

title: Product Manager â€“ Hardgood Product Lines
description:
Who we are:

Founded in 1993, Logomark is a premier supplier of personalized gift and promotional products for the North American and global advertising specialty market. Providing more than 3,000 top-quality products in diverse categories, Logomark persistently reinvents the promotional products industry with exceptional product selections, innovative solutions, and unequaled customer support. Logomark was voted "Greatest Companies to Work For" by PPAI. Check us out at www.Logomark.com.

Position Summary:

This position entails working with hardgood products and not IT-related.

The Product Manager is responsible for purchasing and managing product lines, specializing in tech, gifts, textiles/bags, or tools. The ideal candidate should have a minimum of four years of buying and/or product management experience, with specific knowledge in their respective product types. Extensive experience in overseas buying is required. The role involves market research, analysis, and maintaining a comprehensive understanding of the organization's and competitors' product lines. This includes tracking market conditions, price trends, and identifying future market opportunities. The Product Manager will also monitor and evaluate retail trends, produce competitor analysis reports, and develop successful product ranges for inclusion in Logomark's catalog. Occasional overseas and domestic travel may be required.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Purchase and manage product lines, specializing in gifts, textiles/bags, or tools.
  • Conduct market research and analysis to identify market conditions, price trends, and future market opportunities.
  • Maintain a comprehensive understanding of the organization's and competitors' product lines.
  • Track market conditions and stay updated on industry trends.
  • Monitor retail trends and evaluate their impact on product offerings.
  • Produce competitor analysis reports to assess strengths, weaknesses, and market positioning.
  • Develop successful product ranges that meet quality standards, competitive prices, and exceed end users' expectations.
  • Utilize extensive experience in overseas buying to source products and negotiate with suppliers.
  • Collaborate with suppliers to ensure timely delivery and product quality.
  • Work closely with the catalog team to select and present products for inclusion in Logomark's catalog.
  • Occasionally travel overseas and domestically for sourcing, supplier visits, and industry events.
  • Stay informed about advancements, innovations, and emerging trends within the gifts, textiles/bags, or tools industries.
  • Maintain effective communication and collaborate with cross-functional teams, including sales, marketing, and production.
  • Identify opportunities for product line expansion or diversification based on market research and customer needs.
  • Continuously analyze product performance, marketing strategies, and promotional efforts to make data-driven recommendations for improvements, optimizations, or potential discontinuations.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Minimum of four years of product buying experience in the retail or promotional industry.
  • Extensive knowledge of specific product types, such as gifts, textiles/bags, or tools.
  • Must be able to travel domestically and internationally.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Proficiency in computer skills, including the use of Excel (advanced knowledge preferred).
  • Demonstrated ability to outperform expectations and maintain a positive attitude.
  • Consistently exhibit professional behavior in all communications.
  • Strong negotiation skills.
  • Proven initiative and resourcefulness.
  • Possess a strong work ethic and reliability.
  • Self-motivated and open to embracing changes and challenges.
  • Ability to work effectively as part of a team.
  • Creative mindset to contribute to product development.
  • Fluent in Chinese preferred.

Physical Requirements:

  • Ability to sit, stand, and walk for extended periods of time.
  • Ability to lift, push, pull, and carry materials weighing up to 25 pounds.
  • Ability to work in a manufacturing environment, including extended periods working on a computer.

Please note that this job description is intended to provide a general overview of the responsibilities and qualifications required for this position. It does not encompass all tasks or accountabilities that may be assigned or expected.

We offer a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and a dynamic work environment with opportunities for growth and advancement. If you're a highly driven Product Manager with a passion for delivering innovative solutions and driving product success, we want to hear from you! Please submit your resume to apply for this exciting opportunity.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $70,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • 401(k)
  • Dental insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Flexible spending account
  • Health insurance
  • Health savings account
  • Life insurance
  • Paid time off
  • Referral program
  • Retirement plan
  • Vision insurance

Application Question(s):

  • Are you aware this role is not IT-related?

Ability to Commute:

  • Tustin, CA 92780 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Senior Product Manager, Global Affluent Platforms
description:
Company Description


Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.

Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.


Job Description


Visa’s Affluent Platforms division within the Global Affluent & Benefits organization is responsible for building products and capabilities that are critical for growing Visa’s card payments especially in the Affluent segment. As a key member of the Affluent Platforms team, this role will be responsible for the ongoing product management, development and expansion of global Visa Affluent platform products, which include APIs, UIs, backend systems and solution partners that enable Visa and Issuers to create, manage and distribute powerful cardholder value propositions globally. This role involves supporting and spearheading the development of new features, improving existing ones, and ensuring the overall functionality of the product platforms with special focus on distributing benefits in conjunction with benefit partners. In addition, this role will drive the strategic solutioning of the benefits distribution capability, ensuring alignment with regions and, the global Affluent platform vision.

Key activities include:

  • Supporting regions and other stakeholders in delivering the distribution of global and regional benefit experiences
  • Driving the working relationships that deliver upon requirements across various stakeholders including 3rd party partners
  • Establishing and growing the relationship with tech partners to ensure end to end delivery of the full benefits value chain solution
  • Establishing and growing the relationship with key areas of the business including the global design, legal and privacy teams.
  • Supporting delivery teams with clarity where needed and actively solving for blockers
  • Own appropriate Visa, Benefit Partner and 3rd Party Partner roadmaps and backlogs
  • Act as subject matter expert on all aspects of benefit distribution and benefit partner integrations.
  • Drive stakeholder communication including user guides, implementation guides and sales packs as well as stakeholder education, training and socialization sessions.

Responsibilities:

  • Product Solutions: Drive and develop product strategy and solutions
  • Process: Establish, document, and refine development and operational processes for the product and product development and operational engagement for partners with the distribution capabilities.
  • Product Engagements: Build key relationships with regional and global stakeholders to ensure product requirements are well-rounded and prioritized appropriately.
  • Operational Activities: Build key relationships with business and technology teams to ensure solutions are aligned and delivered.

This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in the office will be confirmed by your Hiring Manager.


Qualifications


Basic Qualifications:

  • 8 or more years of relevant work experience with a Bachelor Degree or at least 5 years of experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD) or 2 years of work experience with a PhD


Preferred Qualifications

  • 9 or more years of relevant work experience with a Bachelor Degree or 7 or more relevant years of experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD) or 3 or more years of experience with a PhD
  • 6 + years of experience in product management, technology product development, or a related field.
  • Experience and comfort adapting to work on different types of products
  • Experience leading and managing complex, cross-functional technical projects including familiarity with integration technology and self-serve administrative functions.
  • Superior strategic thinking, analytical, and problem-solving skills, with demonstrated intellectual and analytical rigor and attention to detail.
  • Strong technical literacy, ability to work closely with engineering and technical teams.
  • Personal presence and ability to clearly communicate compelling messages to senior stakeholders and external business partners.
  • Proactive self-starter, team oriented, collaborative, diplomatic, and adaptable, with excellent presentation skills, including strong oral and writing capabilities.
  • Experience in and/or significant exposure to the payments, financial services, or technology sectors especially where integration between different organizations is key.


Additional Information


Work Authorization: Permanent Authorization to work in the U.S. is a precondition of employment for this position. Visa will not sponsor applicants for work visas in connection with this position.

Work Hours: Varies upon the needs of the department.

Travel Requirements: This position requires travel 5-10% of the time.

Mental/Physical Requirements: This position will be performed in an office setting. The position will require the incumbent to sit and stand at a desk, communicate in person and by telephone, frequently operate standard office equipment, such as telephones and computers.

Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Visa will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable local law, including the requirements of Article 49 of the San Francisco Police Code.

U.S. APPLICANTS ONLY: The estimated salary range for a new hire into this position is 169,100.00 to 245,400.00 USD per year, which may include potential sales incentive payments (if applicable). Salary may vary depending on job-related factors which may include knowledge, skills, experience, and location. In addition, this position may be eligible for bonus and equity. Visa has a comprehensive benefits package for which this position may be eligible that includes Medical, Dental, Vision, 401 (k), FSA/HSA, Life Insurance, Paid Time Off, and Wellness Program.

title: Principal Outbound Product Manager - App Engine
description:
Company Description


It all started in sunny San Diego, California in 2004 when a visionary engineer, Fred Luddy, saw the potential to transform how we work. Fast forward to today — ServiceNow stands as a global market leader, bringing innovative AI-enhanced technology to over 8,100 customers, including 85% of the Fortune 500®. Our intelligent cloud-based platform seamlessly connects people, systems, and processes to empower organizations to find smarter, faster, and better ways to work. But this is just the beginning of our journey. Join us as we pursue our purpose to make the world work better for everyone.


Job Description


We are seeking an experienced Outbound Product Manager to drive go-to-market (GTM) strategy, sales enablement, and customer/partner engagement for core App Engine products. These solutions help our customers unlock the full power of the ServiceNow AI Platform through developer focused products like ServiceNow Studio and admin oriented offerings like App Engine Management Center that simplify and streamline governance and software development lifecycle activities.

Role:

You will be responsible for leading GTM Strategy, supporting the definition and execution of launch plans for new App Engine products & features, and collaborating with inbound PM, marketing, and sales teams. You will act as a trusted advisor to customers and partners, guiding them through product journeys and gathering feedback to inform roadmap decisions.

To support our internal stakeholders, specifically sales teams, you will develop technical content and enablement materials that articulate the differentiating value of App Engine and Generative AI offerings. As you bring new products and capabilities to market, you’ll partner with pricing strategy and operations teams to optimize product packaging and pricing for market adoption.

This role involves extensive cross-functional collaboration, requiring in-depth engagement with technical sellers, customer outcomes, product success, training, and certification teams to ensure alignment and execution.

You will serve as subject matter expert for your products, providing thought leadership internally and externally and representing App Engine in strategic customer conversations, industry events, and internal forums to amplify product awareness.

What you get to do in this role:

  • Develop a deep understanding of our App Engine products, including use cases, gains, pains, and success outcomes
  • Support high profile customers as they adopt ServiceNow’s latest App Engine capabilities
  • Represent the voice of the customer to influence product quality and roadmap direction
  • Attain a high level of technical acumen with ServiceNow’s GenAI capabilities
  • Lead early access initatives to validate forthcoming product capabilities
  • Develop high-quality technical enablement content that describes the differentiating value of product innovation with App Engine products and facilitates adoption at scale
  • Solicit ongoing Voice of Customer (VOC), along with partner, field, support, and BUs’ feedback on product roadmap to inform product strategy, identify candidates for customer programs and references
  • Develop best practices assets and conduct quarterly product onboarding sessions to drive adoption by customers and partners
  • Own community presence and adoption oriented content for the solutions
  • Become a trusted resource to promote the ServiceNow vision with industry influencers, strategic partners, and analyst firms
  • Lead and influence cross-functional teams to accomplish our goals

Qualifications


To succeed in this role you have:

  • A minimum of 8 years of related experience; MBA with 6 years of related customer-facing experience in product management, presales consulting, technical business development, or management consulting at an enterprise software company or SaaS company (preferred)
    • 5+ years of experience in application development on the ServiceNow platform
  • Extreme sense of ownership – own the problem, the process, and the outcome. Some things may need “driving by influence”, others may need executing yourself in a hands-on manner, and yet others will need delegation.
  • Strong bias towards action, and a sense of urgency to “win” in the market.
  • Experience operating in an ambitious environment and driving the adoption of new and emerging products
  • Consistent track record of working cross-functionally to deliver business impact
  • Demonstrated customer obsession in engagements
  • Demonstrated consistent ability to drive both strategy and results.
  • Excellent people and presentation skills to engage with all levels of customers, colleagues, cross-functional teams, and partners.
  • Strong networking and influencing skills; able to drive extended and virtual teams
  • Outstanding written and oral communication skills.
  • Experience in leveraging or critically thinking about how to integrate AI into work processes, decision-making, or problem-solving. This may include using AI-powered tools, automating workflows, analyzing AI-driven insights, or exploring AI's potential impact on the function or industry

#productjobs

For positions in this location, we offer a base pay of $163,600 - $286,300, plus equity (when applicable), variable/incentive compensation and benefits. Sales positions generally offer a competitive On Target Earnings (OTE) incentive compensation structure. Please note that the base pay shown is a guideline, and individual total compensation will vary based on factors such as qualifications, skill level, competencies, and work location. We also offer health plans, including flexible spending accounts, a 401(k) Plan with company match, ESPP, matching donations, a flexible time away plan and family leave programs. Compensation is based on the geographic location in which the role is located and is subject to change based on work location.


Additional Information


Work Personas

We approach our distributed world of work with flexibility and trust. Work personas (flexible, remote, or required in office) are categories that are assigned to ServiceNow employees depending on the nature of their work and their assigned work location. Learn more here. To determine eligibility for a work persona, ServiceNow may confirm the distance between your primary residence and the closest ServiceNow office using a third-party service.

Equal Opportunity Employer

ServiceNow is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other category protected by law. In addition, all qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with legal requirements.

Accommodations

We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are unable to use this online application and need an alternative method to apply, please contact globaltalentss@servicenow.com for assistance.

Export Control Regulations

For positions requiring access to controlled technology subject to export control regulations, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may be required to obtain export control approval from government authorities for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by relevant export control authorities.

title: Sr Product Manager - da Vinci Multiport
description:
Company Description

At Intuitive, we are united behind our mission: we believe that minimally invasive care is life-enhancing care. Through ingenuity and intelligent technology, we expand the potential of physicians to heal without constraints.

As a pioneer and market leader in robotic-assisted surgery, we strive to foster an inclusive and diverse team, committed to making a difference. For more than 25 years, we have worked with hospitals and care teams around the world to help solve some of healthcare's hardest challenges and advance what is possible.

Intuitive has been built by the efforts of great people from diverse backgrounds. We believe great ideas can come from anywhere. We strive to foster an inclusive culture built around diversity of thought and mutual respect. We lead with inclusion and empower our team members to do their best work as their most authentic selves.

Passionate people who want to make a difference drive our culture. Our team members are grounded in integrity, have a strong capacity to learn, the energy to get things done, and bring diverse, real world experiences to help us think in new ways. We actively invest in our team members to support their long-term growth so they can continue to advance our mission and achieve their highest potential.

Join a team committed to taking big leaps forward for a global community of healthcare professionals and their patients. Together, let's advance the world of minimally invasive care.

Job Description

Primary Function of Multiport Product Manager:

You will manage da Vinci® Multiport products across the entire product lifecycle. You will develop and conduct market and user research, make product proposals, write product requirements and lead the product through development, design and launch stages. Responsibilities include product business & strategic modeling, product user needs & requirements management, market research, customer interaction, forecasting, pricing, competitive analysis, and new product proposals. You will have the ability to frame these efforts by surgical specialty and product technology.

In your first year, you can expect to:

  • Assist in managing the Multiport product roadmap and lifecycle in alignment with the multiport portfolio objectives. Develop business justification for recommendations and gain alignment across key stakeholders on project prioritization.

  • Develop the business justification for new products and features by working with customers and company stakeholders. Develop business analyses, including competitive assessments, to facilitate sound data-driven decision making.

  • Use qualitative and quantitative market research methods and direct customer interviews and observations to develop insights that inform the product roadmap. Refine requirements with feedback from customers, clinical sales and clinical development engineering.

  • Lead cross-functional product teams including engineering, sales and marketing to execute against the product plan.

  • Represent product management in the product development process, complete deliverables such as market requirements and product requirements documents and facilitate tradeoff discussions with design teams while keeping the needs of the customer and the business in mind.

  • Engage with Human Factors and Interaction Design partners during the development process by establishing design requirements, prioritizing design efforts, coordinating design reviews, and documenting and communicating design decisions.

  • Convey product value proposition to global marketing for global product positioning and messaging.

  • Measure product success by monitoring product adoption and seeking post-launch product feedback.

  • Develop a deep understanding of the surgical treatments for applicable indications, including monitoring and consuming clinical literature, attending medical society meetings and engaging with physician key opinion leaders (KOLs).

  • Collaboratively develop global product commercialization plans with regional marketing and commercial teams.

  • Understand competitive, emerging and complementary technology and its potential impact on Intuitive’s product lines.

  • Work with the product engineering and business development teams to evaluate new technologies and prioritize the new business development pipeline.

  • Monitor and prioritize product quality issues. Work on cross-functional teams to resolve product issues and critical customer issues.

  • Conduct additional activities across the product lifecycle as needed including, participating in product education program development and supporting sustaining product activities including end of life.

Qualifications

Primary Function of Multiport Product Manager:

You will manage da Vinci® Multiport products across the entire product lifecycle. You will develop and conduct market and user research, make product proposals, write product requirements and lead the product through development, design and launch stages. Responsibilities include product business & strategic modeling, product user needs & requirements management, market research, customer interaction, forecasting, pricing, competitive analysis, and new product proposals. You will have the ability to frame these efforts by surgical specialty and product technology.

In your first year, you can expect to:

  • Assist in managing the Multiport product roadmap and lifecycle in alignment with the multiport portfolio objectives. Develop business justification for recommendations and gain alignment across key stakeholders on project prioritization.

  • Develop the business justification for new products and features by working with customers and company stakeholders. Develop business analyses, including competitive assessments, to facilitate sound data-driven decision making.

  • Use qualitative and quantitative market research methods and direct customer interviews and observations to develop insights that inform the product roadmap. Refine requirements with feedback from customers, clinical sales and clinical development engineering.

  • Lead cross-functional product teams including engineering, sales and marketing to execute against the product plan.

  • Represent product management in the product development process, complete deliverables such as market requirements and product requirements documents and facilitate tradeoff discussions with design teams while keeping the needs of the customer and the business in mind.

  • Engage with Human Factors and Interaction Design partners during the development process by establishing design requirements, prioritizing design efforts, coordinating design reviews, and documenting and communicating design decisions.

  • Convey product value proposition to global marketing for global product positioning and messaging.

  • Measure product success by monitoring product adoption and seeking post-launch product feedback.

  • Develop a deep understanding of the surgical treatments for applicable indications, including monitoring and consuming clinical literature, attending medical society meetings and engaging with physician key opinion leaders (KOLs).

  • Collaboratively develop global product commercialization plans with regional marketing and commercial teams.

  • Understand competitive, emerging and complementary technology and its potential impact on Intuitive’s product lines.

  • Work with the product engineering and business development teams to evaluate new technologies and prioritize the new business development pipeline.

  • Monitor and prioritize product quality issues. Work on cross-functional teams to resolve product issues and critical customer issues.

  • Conduct additional activities across the product lifecycle as needed including, participating in product education program development and supporting sustaining product activities including end of life.

Required Expertise

We believe you are a good fit for this role if you have the following qualifications:

  • Minimum Bachelor’s degree required. MBA strongly preferred

  • Minimum 6 or more years professional experience in product management, marketing, sales, , engineering, or equivalent role

  • Experience in surgical robotics or surgical devices preferred

  • Demonstrated interest in healthcare, hospital operations and medical devices

  • Good written and verbal communications skills

  • Excellent teamwork skills with proven ability to collaborate across multiple disciplines to ensure product success and ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authority. This includes the ability to lead in bridging communication between engineering, design, marketing, sales, and customers.

  • Presentation skills to internal & external audiences including leaders at the VP level

  • Self-directed with awareness to proactively seek advice when needed

  • Quantitative mindset, proven ability to investigate open-ended problems and work cross-functionally to implement initiatives

  • Humble nature, demonstrated ability to work creatively amidst competing priorities, and ability to communicate in a clear, concise, and professional manner

  • Ability to prioritize and smoothly manage multiple competing deadlines and tasks

  • Knowledge of urology and gynecology surgical specialties preferred

  • Strong knowledge of the MS Office product suite

  • Ability to travel up to 25% globally

Shift : Shift 1 - Day

Travel : Yes, 25 %

Additional Information

Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Details can vary by role.

Intuitive is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants and employees, and prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type, without regard to race, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, color, age, religion, protected veteran or disability status, genetic information or any other status protected under federal, state, or local applicable laws.

Mandatory Notices

U.S. Export Controls Disclaimer: In accordance with the U.S. Export Administration Regulations (15 CFR §743.13(b)), some roles at Intuitive Surgical may be subject to U.S. export controls for prospective employees who are nationals from countries currently on embargo or sanctions status.

Certain information you provide as part of the application will be used for purposes of determining whether Intuitive Surgical will need to (i) obtain an export license from the U.S. Government on your behalf (note: the government’s licensing process can take 3 to 6+ months) or (ii) implement a Technology Control Plan (“TCP”) (note: typically adds 2 weeks to the hiring process).

For any Intuitive role subject to export controls, final offers are contingent upon obtaining an approved export license and/or an executed TCP prior to the prospective employee’s start date, which may or may not be flexible, and within a timeframe that does not unreasonably impede the hiring need. If applicable, candidates will be notified and instructed on any requirements for these purposes.

We will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accordance with fair chance laws.

Preference will be given to qualified candidates who do not reside, or plan to reside, in Alabama, Arkansas, Delaware, Florida, Indiana, Iowa, Louisiana, Maryland, Mississippi, Missouri, Oklahoma, Pennsylvania, South Carolina, or Tennessee.

We provide market-competitive compensation packages, inclusive of base pay, incentives, benefits, and equity. It would not be typical for someone to be hired at the top end of range for the role, as actual pay will be determined based on several factors, including experience, skills, and qualifications. The target compensation ranges are listed.

Base Salary Range Region 1:$168,900 - $243,100
Base Salary Range Region 2: $143,600 - $206,600
Shift: Day
Workplace Type: Onsite - This job is fully onsite.

title: Product Manager - Multiport
description:
Company Description

At Intuitive, we are united behind our mission: we believe that minimally invasive care is life-enhancing care. Through ingenuity and intelligent technology, we expand the potential of physicians to heal without constraints.

As a pioneer and market leader in robotic-assisted surgery, we strive to foster an inclusive and diverse team, committed to making a difference. For more than 25 years, we have worked with hospitals and care teams around the world to help solve some of healthcare's hardest challenges and advance what is possible.

Intuitive has been built by the efforts of great people from diverse backgrounds. We believe great ideas can come from anywhere. We strive to foster an inclusive culture built around diversity of thought and mutual respect. We lead with inclusion and empower our team members to do their best work as their most authentic selves.

Passionate people who want to make a difference drive our culture. Our team members are grounded in integrity, have a strong capacity to learn, the energy to get things done, and bring diverse, real world experiences to help us think in new ways. We actively invest in our team members to support their long-term growth so they can continue to advance our mission and achieve their highest potential.

Join a team committed to taking big leaps forward for a global community of healthcare professionals and their patients. Together, let's advance the world of minimally invasive care.

Job Description

As a global upstream product manager on the da Vinci® Multiport team, you will become a key development and design stage stakeholder for multiple projects and provide a clinical specialty (e.g., urology) perspective. This is an individual contributor role and will report to a Sr. Group Product Manager.

You will work with cross-functional partners to identify needs; define and guide products through the development process; become a global portfolio expert helping to guide future portfolio recommendations; and work with the commercial downstream teams for product launches. Responsibilities include product business & strategic modeling, product user needs & requirements management, market research, customer interaction, forecasting, pricing, competitive analysis, and supporting commercialized products.

Essential Job Duties (Specific responsibilities and tasks an individual would be expected to perform in the role. Additional job duties may be determined by functional people manager)

  • Develop a deep understanding of the surgical treatments for applicable indications, including monitoring and consuming clinical literature, attending medical society meetings, engaging with physician key opinion leaders (KOLs), and observing live robotic cases. Will require both domestic and international travel.

  • Capture, refine, and validate user needs with feedback from customers, the commercial team, and clinical development engineering. Establish design requirements, prioritize design efforts, navigate tradeoffs, and document and communicate design decisions.

  • Assist in managing the Multiport product roadmap and lifecycle in alignment with the multiport portfolio objectives. Develop business justification for recommendations and gain alignment across key stakeholders on project prioritization.

  • Use qualitative and quantitative market research methods and direct customer interviews and observations to develop insights that inform product development and the product roadmap.

  • Collaboratively develop global product commercialization plans with global portfolio marketing, regional marketing, and commercial teams.

  • Work with the product engineering and business development teams to evaluate new technologies and prioritize the new business development pipeline.

Qualifications

Required Skills and Experience (Specific skills, knowledge, and experience that an individual must possess in order to successfully perform in job)

  • Humble, mindful of other people’s input, and able to communicate in a clear, concise, and professional manner.

  • Self-directed with awareness to proactively seek advice and develop professional skills.

  • Excellent teamwork skills with proven ability to collaborate across multiple disciplines to ensure product success and ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authority. This includes the ability to lead in bridging communication between engineering, design, marketing, sales, and customers.

  • Presentation skills to internal and external audiences including leaders at the VP level. Strong PowerPoint or equivalent modality skillset.

  • Quantitative mindset, proven ability to investigate open-ended problems, break into first principles analysis, and work cross-functionally to implement initiatives.

  • Demonstrated ability to work creatively amidst competing priorities and smoothly manage multiple competing deadlines and tasks.

Required Education and Training (As applicable - Specific education and training that an individual must possess in order to successfully perform in job)

  • Minimum Bachelor’s degree

  • Minimum 4 or more years cumulative professional experience in product management, marketing, engineering, business development, or equivalent role

Working Conditions (As applicable - Any physical requirements for the job. If not applicable, state “none”)

none

Preferred Skills and Experience (As applicable - Specific skills, knowledge, and experience that are not required to perform the job, but are desirable to have)

  • MBA or equivalent experience in role

  • 2 years upstream Product Management or equivalent experience in medical device role

Additional Information

Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Details can vary by role.

Intuitive is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants and employees, and prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type, without regard to race, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, color, age, religion, protected veteran or disability status, genetic information or any other status protected under federal, state, or local applicable laws.

Mandatory Notices

U.S. Export Controls Disclaimer: In accordance with the U.S. Export Administration Regulations (15 CFR §743.13(b)), some roles at Intuitive Surgical may be subject to U.S. export controls for prospective employees who are nationals from countries currently on embargo or sanctions status.

Certain information you provide as part of the application will be used for purposes of determining whether Intuitive Surgical will need to (i) obtain an export license from the U.S. Government on your behalf (note: the government’s licensing process can take 3 to 6+ months) or (ii) implement a Technology Control Plan (“TCP”) (note: typically adds 2 weeks to the hiring process).

For any Intuitive role subject to export controls, final offers are contingent upon obtaining an approved export license and/or an executed TCP prior to the prospective employee’s start date, which may or may not be flexible, and within a timeframe that does not unreasonably impede the hiring need. If applicable, candidates will be notified and instructed on any requirements for these purposes.

We will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accordance with fair chance laws.

We provide market-competitive compensation packages, inclusive of base pay, incentives, benefits, and equity. It would not be typical for someone to be hired at the top end of range for the role, as actual pay will be determined based on several factors, including experience, skills, and qualifications. The target base compensation ranges are listed.

Base Salary Range Region 1:$143,500 - $206,500
Base Salary Range Region 2: $122,000 - $175,600

title: Senior Product Manager, Rovo Demo Platforms and Go-to-Market
description:
Overview:

Working at Atlassian

Atlassians can choose where they work – whether in an office, from home, or a combination of the two. That way, Atlassians have more control over supporting their family, personal goals, and other priorities. We can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity.

Role Summary

As Senior Product Manager for Rovo, you will be at the forefront of one of Atlassian’s highest strategic priorities—tasked with getting Rovo into the hands of millions of users worldwide. You will lead Rovo’s go-to-market partnership, elevating pre- and post-sales field readiness, and shaping a world-class, customer-facing demo environment.

In this highly visible role, you’ll unite cross-functional partners across technical sales, solutions, marketing, and product squads, serving as the vital bridge between product and market. You’ll transform roadmap themes and golden use cases into compelling, sales-ready collateral and scalable demo experiences that inspire both customers and field teams.

This is your opportunity to drive impact at scale, accelerate Rovo’s adoption, and help define how Atlassian delivers transformative AI-powered experiences to organizations everywhere.

Responsibilities:

Key Responsibilities

Go-to-Market Product Partner

  • Scale pre‑ and post‑sales field readiness; work with technical sales and solution teams to capture feedback loops, prioritize backlog items, and shape the roadmap.

  • Collaborate with Marketing to develop and maintain collateral that communicates roadmap themes and backlog priorities. Compile and publish the Rovo PM roadmap for the field audience.

  • Partner with go-to-market teams (sales, solutions engineering, partner enablement) to ensure consistent messaging and seamless hand‑off.

Demo Environment & Public Materials

  • Own the customer-facing demo environment for field teams and Team 26 events

  • Define and promote “golden use cases” with Rovo product teams that connect product capabilities to customer needs. Develop these use cases in the demo environment, building out appropriate content, capabilities, and training.

  • Improve the 3P data access in the customer‑facing demo environment for testing Rovo in real‑world scenarios.

  • Track demo usage metrics, adoption KPIs, and field feedback to iterate on demo experiences.

  • Partner with Marketing to enhance content on public website, improve upon and further develop use case library, and regularly publish content on the Atlassian Community.

  • Lead the design and delivery of a new demo environment on the public website to enable prospects and customers to explore product features in a self-serve capacity.

Communication

  • Craft clear, compelling narratives for internal and external audiences (written and verbal).

  • Present roadmap updates and adoption results to senior leadership and field teams.

  • Represent Rovo in demos and executive briefings on customer calls.

Qualifications:

Minimum Qualifications

  • 5+ years of product management experience, with a strong focus on go‑to‑market, field enablement, or developer‑facing platforms.

  • Proven track record launching AI features or programs that directly impacted sales velocity, customer activation, or product adoption.

  • Experience partnering with technical sales and marketing to create collateral, use‑case libraries, and demo assets.

  • Excellent stakeholder management and negotiation skills in a matrixed organization.

  • Strong written and verbal communication; ability to tell a product story to both technical and non‑technical audiences.

  • Data‑driven decision‑making – comfortable working with usage metrics, adoption dashboards, and feedback loops.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with AI‑driven SaaS products and understanding of enterprise AI goals and concerns.

  • Background building or managing public demo environments, sandbox platforms, or self‑serve trial experiences.

  • Familiarity with Atlassian’s ecosystem (Jira, Confluence, JSM, etc.) and the Rovo product suite a bonus.

  • Prior work in a fast‑moving, cross‑functional AI or cloud product team.

What You’ll Bring

  • Strategic Vision: Ability to translate product roadmaps into field‑ready GTM strategies and tangible demo experiences.

  • Customer Empathy: Deep understanding of enterprise buyer journeys and the friction points that prevent AI adoption.

  • Bias for Action: Structured, proactive execution style that drives demo environment improvements from concept to production.

  • Collaboration DNA: Comfortable influencing without authority, building consensus across product, engineering, sales, and marketing.

Compensation

At Atlassian, we strive to design equitable, explainable, and competitive compensation programs. To support this goal, the baseline of our range is higher than that of the typical market range, but in turn we expect to hire most candidates near this baseline. Base pay within the range is ultimately determined by a candidate's skills, expertise, or experience. In the United States, we have three geographic pay zones. For this role, our current base pay ranges for new hires in each zone are:

Zone A: $164,700 - $215,025

Zone B: $148,500 - $193,875

Zone C: $136,800 - $178,600

This role may also be eligible for benefits, bonuses, commissions, and equity.

Please visit go.atlassian.com/payzones for more information on which locations are included in each of our geographic pay zones. However, please confirm the zone for your specific location with your recruiter.

Benefits & Perks

Atlassian offers a wide range of perks and benefits designed to support you, your family and to help you engage with your local community. Our offerings include health and wellbeing resources, paid volunteer days, and so much more. To learn more, visit go.atlassian.com/perksandbenefits.

About Atlassian

At Atlassian, we're motivated by a common goal: to unleash the potential of every team. Our software products help teams all over the planet and our solutions are designed for all types of work. Team collaboration through our tools makes what may be impossible alone, possible together.

We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians create our success. To ensure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience, we never discriminate based on race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

To provide you the best experience, we can support with accommodations or adjustments at any stage of the recruitment process. Simply inform our Recruitment team during your conversation with them.

To learn more about our culture and hiring process, visit go.atlassian.com/crh.
