title: Product Manager, Sales Enablement & Technology
description:
SCAN Group is a not-for-profit organization dedicated to tackling the most pressing issues facing older adults in the United States. SCAN Group is the sole corporate member of SCAN Health Plan, one of the nation’s leading not-for-profit Medicare Advantage plans, serving more than 277,000 members in California, Arizona, Nevada, Texas and New Mexico. SCAN has been a mission-driven organization dedicated to keeping seniors healthy and independent for more than 45 years and is known throughout the healthcare industry and nationally as a leading expert in senior healthcare.

SCAN employees are a group of talented, passionate professionals who are committed to supporting older adults on their aging journey, while also innovating healthcare for seniors everywhere. Employees are provided in-depth training and access to state-of-the-art tools necessary to do their jobs, as well as development and growth opportunities. SCAN takes great pride in recognizing our team members as experts in their fields and rewarding them for their efforts. If you are interested in becoming part of an organization that is innovating senior healthcare visit www.thescangroup.org, www.scanhealthplan.com, or follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook, and Twitter.

Job Description:

About SCAN

SCAN Group is a not-for-profit organization dedicated to tackling the most pressing issues facing older adults in the United States. SCAN Group is the sole corporate member of SCAN Health Plan, one of the nation’s leading not-for-profit Medicare Advantage plans, serving more than 285,000 members in California, Arizona, Nevada, and Texas. SCAN has been a mission-driven organization dedicated to keeping sAeniors healthy and independent for more than 40 years and is known throughout the healthcare industry and nationally as a leading expert in senior healthcare. SCAN employees are a group of talented, passionate professionals who are committed to supporting older adults on their aging journey, while also innovating healthcare for seniors everywhere. Employees are provided in-depth training and access to state-of-the-art tools necessary to do their jobs, as well as development and growth opportunities. SCAN takes great pride in recognizing our team members as experts in their fields and rewarding them for their efforts. If you are interested in becoming part of an organization that is innovating senior healthcare visit www.thescangroup.org, www.scanhealthplan.com, or follow us on LinkedIn; Facebook; and Twitter.

The Job

The Product Manager – Sales Enablement & Technology serves as the business lead for all sales related technology platforms — including sales CRM, agent portal, electronic enrollment platforms, agent Learning Management Systems, and other agent enablement tools. This role sits within the sales organization, bridging sales, technology/digital teams, and external vendors. This role is responsible for driving the strategy, development, and continuous improvement of sales platforms that enable internal teams, brokers, and partners to sell Medicare Advantage effectively and compliantly.

You Will

Define and continuously evolve the product vision for sales-related technology platforms aligned to business strategy and growth goals.

Partner with stakeholders across Sales, Digital Strategy, Operations, Compliance, Marketing, IT and Engineering to identify and address sales agents’ pain points via technological enhancements.

Develop rollout, communication, and training plans for new technology implementations in order to drive adoption and feedback loops.

Prioritize technological enhancements based on sales strategy, business impact, usability, compliance requirements, and agent/user feedback.

Serve as the daily liaison between sales, technology, digital and other cross-functional teams; represent the sales organization in agile sprint reviews, backlog grooming, and UAT testing.

Measure and optimize performance using KPIs such as application throughput, broker satisfaction, conversion rates and system uptime.

Ensure compliance with CMS sales and marketing guidelines in all digital and technology touchpoints.

Champion innovation—bring new ideas to reduce friction and improve digital enrollment, broker onboarding, and field sales experience.

We seek Rebels who are curious about AI and its power to transform how we operate and serve our members.

Actively support the achievement of SCAN’s Vision and Goals.

Other duties as assigned.

Your Qualifications

Bachler’s Degree in Business, Healthcare Administration, Product Design, or related field or equivalent experience preferred; MBA a plus

3-5 years of experience in sales operations, sales enablement, or sales technology within health insurance industry; experience with Medicare Advantage Prescription Drug (MAPD) health insurance plans preferred

Strong knowledge of sales agent experience and sales processes, with proven ability to analyze and map end-to-end sales and agent workflows, identifying friction points and opportunities for technology enablement

Strong knowledge of sales technology tools such as CRM, agent broker, enrollment platforms Excellent interpersonal & communication skills. Strong organizational skills; ability to prioritize multiple and competing tasks, working independently and in a team environment

Demonstrated ability to work with all levels of staff, within and external to the organization to achieve goals. Experience with coordinating diverse groups of individuals to achieve overall program success

What's in it for you?

  • Base Pay Range: $106,200-$153,705; Salary

  • Work Mode: Mostly Remote

  • An annual employee bonus program

  • Robust Wellness Program

  • Generous paid-time-off (PTO)

  • 11 paid holidays per year, 1 floating holiday, birthday off, and 2 volunteer days

  • Excellent 401(k) Retirement Saving Plan with employer match

  • Robust employee recognition program

  • Tuition reimbursement

  • An opportunity to become part of a team that makes a difference to our members and our community every day!

We're always looking for talented people to join our team! Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply now!

At SCAN we believe that it is our business to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects our community through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more.

SCAN is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action workplace. Individuals seeking employment will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or any other status protected by law. A background check is required.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: Product Design Manager, XR Tech Design
description:
XR Tech Design accelerates human-centric computing by building foundational XR AI technologies and experiences. Our mission is to create a future where XR AI is seamlessly integrated into everyday life, helping people focus on what matters most.We play a key role in driving innovation across Reality Labs by shaping new technologies and integrating them into the broader product ecosystem. Our team collaborates closely with the Wearables and Metaverse product groups to develop groundbreaking features and experiences that push the boundaries of what’s possible.Our work spans multiple investment areas including; Codec avatars, immersive virtual spaces contextual and generative AI, natural interaction, inputs, precise navigation systems, advanced audio technologies, and much more. This is a unique opportunity to contribute to transformative technologies that will shape the future of connection and interaction on a global scale.


Product Design Manager, XR Tech Design Responsibilities:

  • Build and manage a team of designers and leaders that consistently delivers on projects and is well-balanced across a range of design skill sets
  • Responsible for overall team performance and health, resource allocation, and project prioritization
  • Cultivate a healthy design process for the team, and be a key contributor to theorganization's product strategy, driving business outcomes through design
  • Effectively communicate your team's product goals (both within the team and outside the team), and connect related projects across the company so that problems or joint decisions can be resolved quickly
  • Proactively solicit and provide feedback from designers and a broader product team in order to continually raise our bar for quality
  • Stay on top of industry trends and emerging technologies, including advancements in Artificial Intelligence, Virtual Reality, games, and 3D real-time tools, with an eye toward platform evolution, creator tools, and a working knowledge of influential games and systems
  • Champion the creation and launch of new products and features in ambiguous, emerging spaces
  • Apply a founder’s mindset to identify opportunities, define vision, and drive execution from concept to launch
  • Guide the design and integration of cutting-edge XR AI technologies into the broader product ecosystem
  • Collaborate closely with other product groups to develop innovative features and experiences
  • Partner with engineering, product management, research, and other teams to deliver transformative technologies



Minimum Qualifications:

  • 8+ years of experience in Product Design
  • 4+ years of design leadership experience with direct reports under your guidance and leadership
  • 8+ years of experience working collaboratively with product, engineering, design, content, art, and user research teams
  • Experience building and shipping applications, software, or experiences across a variety of platforms
  • Experience leading product direction and strategic thinking with the experience developing product goals, identify opportunities, and making decisions based on the impact to people and the company
  • Experience with 3D art and visual design principles



Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with delivering 0-1 products from concept stages to launch
  • Experience working on large scale, complex, ambiguous projects across multiple teams
  • Experience managing managers
  • Experience developing or designing VR, AR, XR, and/or AI experiences



About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.


Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.

Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

$196,000/year to $272,000/year + bonus + equity + benefits

Individual compensation is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location. title: Sr. Product Manager, AWS Server Supply Chain
description:
DESCRIPTION

AWS Infrastructure Services owns the design, planning, delivery, and operation of all AWS global infrastructure. In other words, we’re the people who keep the cloud running. We support all AWS data centers and all of the servers, storage, networking, power, and cooling equipment that ensure our customers have continual access to the innovation they rely on. We work on the most challenging problems, with thousands of variables impacting the supply chain — and we’re looking for talented people who want to help.

You’ll join a diverse team of software, hardware, and network engineers, supply chain specialists, security experts, operations managers, and other vital roles. You’ll collaborate with people across AWS to help us deliver the highest standards for safety and security while providing seemingly infinite capacity at the lowest possible cost for our customers. And you’ll experience an inclusive culture that welcomes bold ideas and empowers you to own them to completion.

Amazon Web Services (AWS) provides a highly reliable, scalable, and low-cost cloud platform that powers thousands of businesses in over 190 countries. AWS’ Infrastructure Services & Supply Chain (AIS-SC) organization works to deliver leading-edge solutions to source, build and maintain our socially responsible data center supply chains. We are a team of highly-motivated, engaged, and responsive professionals who enable the core sustainable infrastructure of AWS. Come join our team and be a part of history as we deliver results for the largest cloud services company on Earth!

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is seeking a highly effective candidate to identify, create, develop and integrate innovative technology to deliver the best operating, lowest cost infrastructure in the world.

This individual will lead the manufacturing operations of Integrated Circuits needed for Printed Circuit Board Assemblies that meet our customers' rapidly growing infrastructure needs. Successful candidates will bring strong knowledge of Semiconductor supply chains, semiconductor manufacturing operations, quality assurance operations, and provide oversight of outsourced manufacturing teams.

AWS serves over a million active customers in more than 190 countries. We are steadily expanding global infrastructure to help our customers achieve lower latency and higher throughput. As our customers grow their businesses, AWS will continue to provide infrastructure that meets their global requirements.

Key job responsibilities
  • Develop and implement Printed Circuit Board (PCB) supply chain strategies for AWS hardware infrastructure.
  • Understand PCB industry and technology trends.
  • Identify key technology trends in the PCB industry and drive supplier product roadmaps and execute on strategic initiatives in those products.
  • Negotiate and implement complex supplier agreements and contracts by working with cross-functional stakeholders.
  • Develop negotiations strategies to deliver against business objectives and achieve sustainable relationship with suppliers.
  • Responsible to provide weekly team updates, deliver executive level updates on a monthly basis, and will be responsible for vendor escalations in order to resolve any issues related to his/her category.
  • Present to senior leadership via written narratives.

About the team
Diverse Experiences
AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
Why AWS
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.

Diverse Experiences
Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.

Work/Life Balance
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences.

Mentorship and Career Growth
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.

Professional traits that are necessary for Amazon leaders:
  • Exhibits excellent judgment
  • Has high standards (is never satisfied with the status quo)
  • Is able to dive deep and is never out of touch with the details of the business
  • Expects and requires innovation of her/his team
  • Has passion and convictions and the innate ability to inspire passion in others
  • Strong results orientation
  • Thinks big


BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

  • 5+ years of developing, negotiating and executing business agreements experience
  • 5+ years of professional or military experience
  • Bachelor's degree
  • 5+ years working with the electronics industry in supply chain, operations, manufacturing, or engineering fields.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • Experience interpreting data and making business recommendations
  • Experience identifying, negotiating, and executing complex legal agreements
  • 5+ years of responding to requests for proposals (e.g., determining requirements, matching requirements to technical approach and solutions, developing solutions against requirements) experience
  • 5+ years of experience in Semiconductor and/or PC Industry development and/or manufacturing

title: System Development Manager, PCIe and Signal Integrity, AWS Hardware Components
description:
DESCRIPTION

AWS EC2 owns the design, planning, delivery, and operation of all AWS server instances. In other words, we’re the people who keep the cloud running. We support all AWS compute, storage, accelerator servers and ensure our customers have continual access to the innovation they rely on. We work on the most challenging problems, with thousands of variables impacting the supply chain — and we’re looking for talented people who want to help.

You’ll join a diverse team of hardware engineers, software engineers, system engineers, technical program managers, and other vital roles. You’ll collaborate with people across AWS to help us deliver the highest standards for safety and security while providing seemingly infinite capacity at the lowest possible cost for our customers. And you’ll experience an inclusive culture that welcomes bold ideas and empowers you to own them to completion.

Key job responsibilities
AWS Hardware Engineering is looking for a customer-obsessed, team-driven technology leader to take our engineering of server hardware and software to the next level. As a System Development Manager, you will work on Amazon’s hardest problems, driving the team that owns the designs and operations for PCIe and signal integrity, ensuring interconnects between components are stable and achieving maximum data throughput. You will manage a mix of hardware, software and system engineers that are pushing the technology envelope with novel inventions to solve hard signal integrity problems. Interacting with internal interdisciplinary teams, you will driving PCIe topology for the EC2 servers, including retimer and switch firmware. You will own the development and support for the tools that validate PCIe link quality, assist in identifying and debugging defects, including telemetry and alarming. Maintaining healthy vendor relationships is critical to stay ahead of the curve, including proactive communication and rapidly resolving issues. This is a fast-paced, intellectually challenging position. At AWS we are changing the industry and want individuals who are ready for a challenge to reach beyond what is possible today.

About the team
"*Why AWS*
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.

*Diverse Experiences*
Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.

*Work/Life Balance*
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.

*Inclusive Team Culture*
Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.

*Mentorship and Career Growth*
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.“

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

  • 5+ years of managing system or software development teams experience
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field
  • Experience partnering with product or program management teams
  • 10+ years of engineering experience
  • Experience with PCIe and high speed interconnects
  • Experience partnering with external suppliers and ODMs
  • Experience managing multiple concurrent programs, projects and development teams in an Agile environment

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • Knowledge of professional software engineering & best practices for full software development life cycle, including coding standards, software architectures, code reviews, source control management, continuous deployments, testing, and operational excellence
  • Experience with AWS platforms, services, and design patterns
  • Experience building and operating a cloud-based architecture
  • Experience designing and developing large scale, high-performing applications

title: Sr Product Manager Tech - Identity, Music Growth and Marketing
description:
DESCRIPTION

We are seeking a Senior Product Manager - Tech to lead the Identity and Household Management strategy for our music streaming platform. This is a high-impact opportunity at the intersection of identity, personalization, and shared listening experiences, where you'll solve some of the most complex challenges in the streaming space. You will define how customers manage their profiles, share access, and enjoy seamless, secure, and personalized experiences — whether they’re listening solo or with family.

In this role, you'll partner with Engineering, Data Science, Design, and other Product teams to build identity systems that scale across millions of users. You will shape the long-term vision for identity and household management, balancing privacy, access control, and personalization. You are customer-obsessed and highly analytical. You dive deep into data, map customer journeys, and spot points of friction — then build intuitive solutions that remove those barriers.

We are seeking a Senior Product Manager - Tech to lead the Identity and Household Management strategy for our music streaming platform. This role puts you at the forefront of redefining how families engage with music — across individual and shared experiences, spanning personal devices and communal ones like Alexa.

You’ll own the strategy and execution of new identity journeys that reflect the needs of listeners of all ages, from kids to adults, ensuring that every profile feels personal, secure, and seamless — whether it's being used on a tablet, phone, or a shared smart speaker.

In this role, you’ll collaborate with Engineering, Data Science, Design, and other Product teams to shape the next generation of household music experiences. You are customer-obsessed, deeply curious, and highly data-driven. You thrive in ambiguity and enjoy making the complex feel simple. You use data and research to identify friction points and proactively create solutions that empower families to listen the way they want — with the right level of control, personalization, and flexibility.

This is an opportunity to define and build identity systems from the ground up — systems that go beyond account-based access and instead deliver contextual, intuitive, and delightful experiences for everyone in the home.

Key job responsibilities
As a Sr. Product Manager - Technical on the Identity and Household Management team, you will:

  • Define and drive the roadmap for identity and household experiences across our music streaming platform.
  • Design new identity journeys that adapt to different family members and use cases — including personalized profiles for children, teens, and adults, and shared experiences on devices like Alexa.
  • Build mechanisms that allow families to seamlessly switch between users and contexts, balancing personalization, simplicity, and privacy.
  • Partner closely with cross-functional teams to deliver scalable, privacy-conscious solutions that unlock new listening scenarios.
  • Use customer insights, behavioral data, and experimentation to guide decision-making and optimize experiences.
  • Think big about how identity can become a growth driver — increasing engagement, retention, and satisfaction across diverse user groups.
  • Serve as the voice of the customer and represent diverse household needs in technical and strategic discussions.

A day in the life
As the Sr. Product Manager for Identity and Household Management, your day is a dynamic mix of strategy, problem-solving, and cross-functional collaboration. You might start by diving into metrics to uncover friction in the profile setup flow, then join a design session to refine how families switch users on shared devices like Alexa. You work closely with engineering to evaluate backend architecture for household roles, and align with stakeholders across Legal, Trust, and Content to ensure compliance and delight. You regularly synthesize customer research, write product docs, and shape experiments that balance personalization, privacy, and usability — all while keeping the diverse needs of families at the center of every decision.

About the team
The Identity and Household Management Team builds the foundational experiences that shape how users access, personalize, and share music across devices. We solve multi-user, multi-device challenges at scale — from kids discovering their favorite songs on a tablet, to parents using Alexa to play dinner playlists, to teens curating their own personalized feeds.

We’re reimagining identity not just as access control, but as a framework for inclusive, personalized, and delightful family engagement — across mobile and voice. Our work spans profile creation, switching, household roles, and listening controls, and supports both individual and shared use cases.

Amazon Music is an immersive audio entertainment service that deepens connections between fans, artists, and creators. From personalized music playlists to exclusive podcasts, concert livestreams to artist merch, Amazon Music is innovating at some of the most exciting intersections of music and culture. title: Sr Product Manager Tech - Identity, Music Growth and Marketing
description:
DESCRIPTION

We are seeking a Senior Product Manager - Tech to lead the Identity and Household Management strategy for our music streaming platform. This is a high-impact opportunity at the intersection of identity, personalization, and shared listening experiences, where you'll solve some of the most complex challenges in the streaming space. You will define how customers manage their profiles, share access, and enjoy seamless, secure, and personalized experiences — whether they’re listening solo or with family.

In this role, you'll partner with Engineering, Data Science, Design, and other Product teams to build identity systems that scale across millions of users. You will shape the long-term vision for identity and household management, balancing privacy, access control, and personalization. You are customer-obsessed and highly analytical. You dive deep into data, map customer journeys, and spot points of friction — then build intuitive solutions that remove those barriers.

We are seeking a Senior Product Manager - Tech to lead the Identity and Household Management strategy for our music streaming platform. This role puts you at the forefront of redefining how families engage with music — across individual and shared experiences, spanning personal devices and communal ones like Alexa.

You’ll own the strategy and execution of new identity journeys that reflect the needs of listeners of all ages, from kids to adults, ensuring that every profile feels personal, secure, and seamless — whether it's being used on a tablet, phone, or a shared smart speaker.

In this role, you’ll collaborate with Engineering, Data Science, Design, and other Product teams to shape the next generation of household music experiences. You are customer-obsessed, deeply curious, and highly data-driven. You thrive in ambiguity and enjoy making the complex feel simple. You use data and research to identify friction points and proactively create solutions that empower families to listen the way they want — with the right level of control, personalization, and flexibility.

This is an opportunity to define and build identity systems from the ground up — systems that go beyond account-based access and instead deliver contextual, intuitive, and delightful experiences for everyone in the home.

title: Sr Product Manager â€“ Technical, Amazon Leo for Government
description:
DESCRIPTION

Amazon Leo is Amazon’s low Earth orbit satellite network. Our mission is to deliver fast, reliable internet connectivity to customers beyond the reach of existing networks. From individual households to schools, hospitals, businesses, and government agencies, Amazon Leo will serve people and organizations operating in locations without reliable connectivity.

This position will be working within the Product Management Team within Amazon Leo for Government.

10037

Key job responsibilities
We have an immediate opening for a Sr Product Manager – Technical to support the Amazon Leo for Government (ALG) team focusing on DoD and National Security customers. This position will be based in in the Northern Virginia, El Segundo, CA or Redmond, WA areas. This position will be part of the team managing a family of products for high throughput terminals. This is a unique opportunity to innovate and define groundbreaking communications technology with few legacy constraints. The team develops and designs the Amazon Leo for Government products and analyzes performance such as for overall throughput, latency, and system availability. In this role you will:
  • Write product roadmaps and product description documents,
  • Create detailed product requirements documents based on an intimate knowledge of the specific customer verticals including use case prioritization, feature definition and product roadmap
  • Work with leadership team to set the customer strategy and make appropriate high-judgment trade-offs between features and speed-to-launch
  • Manage entire product life cycle from strategic planning to tactical execution and work with key internal and external stakeholders to deliver on that vision
  • Research and identify new opportunities to innovate on behalf of our customers

Security Clearance: This position requires that the candidate selected be a US Citizen and must currently possess and maintain an active TS/SCI security clearance.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelor's degree
  • 5+ years of experience with feature delivery and tradeoffs of a product.
  • 5+ years of experience contributing to engineering discussions around technology decisions and strategy related to a product.
  • 5+ years of experience in representing and advocating for a variety of critical customers and stakeholders during executive-level prioritization and planning.
  • 5+ years of experience owning/driving roadmap strategy and definition.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • Experience in using analytical tools, such as Tableau, Qlikview, QuickSight
  • Experience in building and driving adoption of new tools

title: Senior Product Manager â€“ AI Experience & Brand
description:
Treasure Data:

At Treasure Data, we’re on a mission to radically simplify how companies use data and AI to create connected customer experiences. Our intelligent customer data platform (CDP) drives revenue growth and operational efficiency across the enterprise to deliver powerful business outcomes.

We are thrilled that Forrester has recognized Treasure Data as a Leader in The Forrester Wave: Customer Data Platforms For B2C. It's an honor to be acknowledged for our efforts in advancing the CDP industry with cutting-edge AI and real-time capabilities.


Furthermore, Treasure Data employees are enthusiastic, data-driven, and customer-obsessed. We are a team of drivers—self-starters who take initiative, anticipate needs, and proactively jump in to solve problems. Our actions reflect our values of honesty, reliability, openness, and humility.

Your Role:

We’re seeking a Senior Product Manager – AI Experience & Brand to define and deliver the next generation of AI-powered product experiences. This role sits at the intersection of product, marketing, and brand, blending deep product leadership with a modern, creative edge to ensure our AI products resonate with the people who use them every day.

You’ll lead the design and execution of agentic AI & marketing cloud experiences that don’t just solve problems, they become a lifestyle product for marketers, operators, and enterprises. Beyond product definition, you’ll help accelerate adoption by shaping hands-on AI bootcamps, product labs, and experience-driven programs that bring the power of AI into the daily rhythm of our users.

This is a role for a builder-visionary: part product leader, part brand storyteller, part hands-on AI experimenter.

Responsibilities & Duties

  • Prototype & validate quickly: use modern AI tools (Claude, multimodal LLMs, RAG systems, agent frameworks) to craft working demos before engaging full hands on product experience cycles.
  • Design lifestyle-oriented product experiences: make AI workflows intuitive, engaging, and habit-forming for marketers and enterprises.
  • Champion AI adoption through brand experiences: lead the creation of AI bootcamps, hands-on product labs, and immersive learning programs that help customers go from curiosity to daily use.
  • Drive product + brand integration: work closely with product marketing and design to ensure every launch, campaign, and product touchpoint reflects a modern, AI-first feel.
  • Engage with customers directly: uncover unmet needs, validate use cases, and co-create product experiences that meet users where they are.
  • Stay ahead of AI + cultural trends, ensuring our products and brand remain fresh, relevant, and differentiated.
  • Support key GTM motions via product launches in tandem with the rest of the product team.

Required Qualifications

  • 5+ years of relevant work experience; ideally across lifestyle brands meeting market moments.
  • Experience connecting product design with brand positioning to create category-defining experiences.
  • Demonstrated success building 0 to 1 products & brands that scale globally.
  • Ability to lead customer-facing programs (bootcamps, labs, workshops) to accelerate adoption.
  • Excellent storytelling skills and executive presence, able to evangelize AI product vision internally and externally.

Bonus: Background in martech/adtech, CDPs, SaaS ecosystems, or experience shaping product-led brand campaigns.

Why Treasure Data

  • Build at the forefront of AI + data, defining not just the tools, but the way enterprises experience AI.
  • Shape AI Suites, Foundry, and Superagent into category-defining products that marketers can’t live without.
  • Blend product leadership with brand innovation to create AI experiences that feel modern, approachable, and indispensable.
  • Collaborate with world-class teams at the cutting edge of AI, data, and experience design.

Physical Requirements

Working out of any regional office in NAM, according to our “Global Hybrid Working Policy.” Please note relocations are at will and can be discussed.

Travel Requirements

Travel up to 50% for customer bootcamps, events, or client engagements.

Perks and Benefits (US):

Our benefit package showcases our culture of care and empathy with


  • Comprehensive medical, dental, vision plans and Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
  • Competitive compensation packages
  • Company paid life insurance 3x salary
  • Company paid short- and long-term disability coverage
  • Retirement planning (401K) with 4% company match
  • Restricted Stock Units (RSU)
  • Flexible Time Off (FTO)
  • Up to 26 weeks paid parental leave including a post-partum night nurse
  • Comprehensive support and access to care for everyone, everywhere through Carrot - our global reproductive health and family-building benefit.

Our Dedication to You:

We value and promote diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging in all aspects of our business and at all levels. Success comes from acknowledging, welcoming, and incorporating diverse perspectives.

Diverse representation alone is not the desired outcome. We also strive to create an inclusive culture that encourages growth, ownership of your role, and achieving innovation in new and unique ways. Your voice will be heard, and we will help amplify it.

Agencies and Recruiters:

We cannot consider your candidate(s) without a contract in place. Any resumes received without having an active agreement will be considered gratis referrals to us. Thank you for your understanding and cooperation!

title: Product Manager - R&D - Enterprise Data & AI Organization
description:
At American Express, our culture is built on a 175-year history of innovation, shared values and Leadership Behaviors, and an unwavering commitment to back our customers, communities, and colleagues. As part of Team Amex, you'll experience this powerful backing with comprehensive support for your holistic well-being and many opportunities to learn new skills, develop as a leader, and grow your career.

Here, your voice and ideas matter, your work makes an impact, and together, you will help us define the future of American Express.

Joining Amex Tech means discovering and shaping your contribution to something big. Here, you can work alongside talented tech teams and build a unique career with the Powerful Backing of American Express. With a range of opportunities to work with the latest technologies, and a commitment to back the broader engineering community through open source, our mission is to power your success. Because Amex Tech is powered by our technology, our culture, and our colleagues.

The Enterprise Data and AI organization unites the data governance, strategy, engineering, and product teams with those responsible for AI engineering, generative AI enablement, and automation product and engineering. This group plays a pivotal role in leveraging data as a core driver of innovation and integrating AI capabilities to transform products, operations, and customer experiences.

The EDAI organization also incorporates technology Research & Development and experimentation with emerging capabilities, along with engineering support for Amex Digital Labs. This integration ensures that research breakthroughs seamlessly translate into business impact.

About the team:

We’re a hands-on team of engineers, product leaders, and researchers. We drive research and experimentation in frontier technologies, foster ecosystem partnerships from our Palo Alto hub, and power the next generation of American Express products and experiences.

About the role:

You'll explore and shape emerging ideas through research, rapid prototyping, and strategic collaboration. This role is ideal for someone who thrives in dynamic, fast-evolving environments and loves turning bold, early-stage concepts into meaningful, real-world impact.

Responsibilities:

  • Understand Amex’s strategic and competitive position.

  • Identify, assess, and synthesize new AI product ideas.

  • Lead hands-on evaluations to refine opportunities from both technical and business perspectives. This may involve generating business concepts, conducting customer interviews, and mostly partnering with engineering teams to develop prototypes, and testing solutions.

  • Establish a shared vision across the company by building alignment on priorities that drive product execution. You’ll play an instrumental role in communicating business ideas, helping colleagues understand their potential, and guiding products toward launch.

  • Drive the product from concept to the pilot phase and support larger deployments.

Minimum Qualifications

  • BA/BS, Master's or equivalent practical experience.

  • 5–8+ years of hands-on experience in product management or product design.

  • Deep understanding AI stack and product cycle.

  • Proven ability to thrive in ambiguous, early-stage environments, turning raw ideas into viable products and businesses from the ground up.

  • Demonstrated success in sourcing and managing external partnerships related to early-stage technologies.

  • Exceptional communication skills — both written and verbal — with the ability to engage effectively with executives and engineers across diverse technical backgrounds.

Bonus:

  • Prior 0-to-1 experience building or launching AI-driven products.

  • Startup experience combined with an appreciation for the complexities and nuances of operating within a large, global organization.

Salary Range: $123,000.00 to $215,250.00 annually + bonus + benefits

The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we’ll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.

We back you with benefits that support your holistic well-being so you can be and deliver your best. This means caring for you and your loved ones' physical, financial, and mental health, as well as providing the flexibility you need to thrive personally and professionally:

  • Competitive base salaries
  • Bonus incentives
  • 6% Company Match on retirement savings plan
  • Free financial coaching and financial well-being support
  • Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability benefits
  • Flexible working model with hybrid, onsite or virtual arrangements depending on role and business need
  • 20+ weeks paid parental leave for all parents, regardless of gender, offered for pregnancy, adoption or surrogacy
  • Free access to global on-site wellness centers staffed with nurses and doctors (depending on location)
  • Free and confidential counseling support through our Healthy Minds program
  • Career development and training opportunities

For a full list of Team Amex benefits, visit our Colleague Benefits Site.

American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law. American Express will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with arrest or conviction records, in accordance with the requirements of applicable state and local laws, including, but not limited to, the California Fair Chance Act, the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance for Employers, and the City of Los Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance. For positions covered by federal and/or state banking regulations, American Express will comply with such regulations as it relates to the consideration of applicants with criminal convictions.

We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That's why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.

title: Product Manager, Sales Products (Ads)
description:
Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services, with over 300 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.

Our Team:

The Ads Platform team builds the advertising systems and integrations that power the delivery of ads using our world class content delivery ecosystem. We deliver ads in a manner that’s thoughtful of our members’ viewing experience and drives great outcomes for advertisers.

Our team is new and yet faced with the ambitions of building highly performant advertising systems and delivering high impact to our business by monetizing our incredible slate of content. As one of the newest entrants in the Connected TV advertising space that’s rapidly growing, we seek to build unique value propositions that differentiate Netflix from other ad-supported streaming services.

We are looking for a Product Manager in the advertising space who is excited to join us on this journey.

About the Role:

We’re building the sales operating system that powers how Netflix Ads understands and grows demand - unifying sales channels, supply sources, and advertiser ecosystems to create a differentiated advertiser understanding and to elevate go-to-market productivity across sales and marketing.

This product manager will build data and go-to-market products that power intelligence, automation, and growth for sales across Netflix Ads.

This PM will:

  • Shape the data strategy that powers how Netflix understands advertisers, demand, and sales - enabling sales and agents to operate on a trusted foundation

  • Champion data quality and governance to strengthen core capabilities including account verification, hierarchies, benchmarks, attribution, and enrichment

  • Evolve the go-to-market architecture to drive a continuous demand loop connecting sales workflows, marketing activation, and business management

  • Elevate sales productivity by embedding agentic workflows and autonomous agents into the daily flow of work

  • Partner closely with sales, engineering, design, ad operations, marketing, strategy, policy, and legal to deliver products that drive measurable advertiser and business outcomes

We’re seeking a candidate who has:

  • 7+ years of Product Management experience successfully launching and scaling products that support diverse sales segments, verticals, and channels

  • A proven track record of building or integrating solutions that use data, AI, and automation to deliver sales insights, recommendations, and workflow efficiency. Ads expertise is a strong plus but not required

  • Exceptional data literacy and data-driven mindset, instinctively using data to shape strategy and measure outcomes

  • An obsession with data quality, believing that accuracy, governance, and the last 1% define future-proof systems for AI

  • A visionary approach to workflow design, constantly exploring how AI and agentic experiences can simplify complexity and elevate how sales teams operate

  • Strategic judgment and communication skills with a bias for clarity, impact, and simplicity

Generally, our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $120k - $515k.

Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs. Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off.

See more detail about our Benefits here .

Inclusion is a Netflix value and we strive to host a meaningful interview experience for all candidates. If you want an accommodation/adjustment for a disability or any other reason during the hiring process, please send a request to your recruiting partner.

We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

title: Head of Product & Tech, Business Development & Partnerships, Amazon Music
description:
DESCRIPTION

The Amazon Music Business Development team is looking for a Senior Manager, Product Management – Technical to lead our Partner & 3P Developer products and services. Your team drives the integration of Amazon Music on 3rd party devices and applications through developer tools, solution architecture services, and the development of innovative partner integrations. This role drives the roadmap for a set of core software services for partners (e.g. 3P APIs, SDKs, onboarding tools) but also must index highly on innovation to drive new customer proposition that unlock future growth and strategic opportunities.

The team is comprised of product, solutions architecture and technical program management. It collaborates very closely with BD, partner marketing, product design, business intelligence, and the broader product/engineering organization, in addition to working directly with external partners. This is a key leadership position on the Amazon Music Business Development team, which is a global team spread across the US, LatAM, and Europe. In addition to leading your team, you will help shape strategy and support the broader BD organization to operate more efficiently and up-level product-led thinking.

Key job responsibilities
  • Develop and execute long-term strategic vision and product strategy for third party developer services and tools, which include APIs, SDKs/Toolkits, and Self-Service Onboarding
  • Lead and develop a diverse and geographically dispersed team across Product, Solution Architecture and Technical Project Management functions, with responsibility for recruiting, mentoring, and developing individuals
  • Own the end-to-end product experience across partner integrations, ensuring a high quality bar and guiding strategic technical decisions that impact our ability to scale and innovate
  • Responsible for creating and maintaining a product roadmap and prioritization framework across multiple stakeholders, driving measurable impact.
  • Generate buy-in for the product vision with leadership, partner teams and partners, managing strategic communications both internally and externally
  • Define and launch new game-changing products and services with partners that drive growth for Amazon Music and support our strategy
  • Anticipate future opportunities based on evaluating the business opportunity and application of new and emerging technologies and changing digital media consumption.
  • Lead product and technical discussions with partners and internal stakeholders, manage prioritization providing clear direction on complex technical trade-offs, and ensuring all solutions meet Amazon's high bar for technical excellence and customer experience.


A day in the life
In this role, you will drive the product strategy, vision, and delivery for new and existing partner experiences. Your customers are our partners as well as Amazon Music customers. As part of the Global Business Development team, you will lead the product and engineering team and take on challenging and varied product opportunities with autonomy and high visibility. You will work closely with business development, design, marketing and other product and engineering teams to bring new products to market. Business Development at Amazon Music has a strong and positive team culture and puts a high value on work-life balance.
We are a highly innovative and diverse global team which is based across continents. The team is fast-paced, nimble and cross-functional, comprised of Business Development, Partner Marketing, Solution Architects, Operations and Product and Engineering. We work on a wide range of partnerships that enable millions of customers to discover and enjoy a delightful Amazon Music experience anytime, driving growth for the business.

About the team
Amazon Music is an immersive audio entertainment service that deepens connections between fans, artists, and creators. From personalized music playlists to exclusive podcasts, concert livestreams to artist merch, Amazon Music is innovating at some of the most exciting intersections of music and culture. We offer experiences that serve all listeners with our different tiers of service: Prime members get access to all the music in shuffle mode, and top ad-free podcasts, included with their membership; customers can upgrade to Amazon Music Unlimited for unlimited, on-demand access to 100 million songs, including millions in HD, Ultra HD, and spatial audio; and anyone can listen for free by downloading the Amazon Music app or via Alexa-enabled devices. Join us for the opportunity to influence how Amazon Music engages fans, artists, and creators on a global scale. Learn more at https://www.amazon.com/music.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

  • 2+ years of team management experience
  • 5+ years of end to end product delivery experience
  • 5+ years of technical product or program management experience
  • Bachelor's degree
  • Experience with feature delivery and tradeoffs of a product
  • Experience owning/driving roadmap strategy and definition
  • Experience leading engineering discussions around technology decisions and strategy related to a product

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • Exceptional written and verbal communication and infliencing skills
  • Track record of building and launching developer platforms or APIs
  • Experience leading geographically distributed teams
  • History of mentoring and developing technical product leaders

Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of protected veteran status, disability, or other legally protected status.

title: Sr. Product Manager - Upgrader, Devices Trade-in Team
description:
DESCRIPTION

We are seeking a strategic and execution-focused Senior Product Manager to drive Amazon Devices' upgrader strategy across Product Lines. You'll own central upgrader capabilities while partnering with teams to develop effective upgrade strategies that impact millions of customers and drive significant business growth.

As the Senior PM for Device Lifecycle Management, you will shape how customers experience device upgrades. This role combines strategic thinking with hands-on execution, requiring both vision-setting and detailed program management. You'll help create scalable upgrader solutions and build partnerships across Product Lines to transform device lifecycle management.

In this role, you will drive upgrade revenue across Amazon's device portfolio while improving customer experience through seamless upgrade paths. You'll be responsible for building strong Product Line partnerships to execute effective upgrade strategies. Your work will shape the future of device lifecycle management at Amazon.

Your efforts will directly influence customer satisfaction, device engagement, and revenue growth through increased upgrade adoption. Success means more customers experiencing our latest innovations. You'll define strategy and execution for programs touching every Amazon device customer while delivering exceptional customer experiences.
Impact will be measured in revenue, upgrade adoption, and creating seamless experiences that drive long-term engagement with Amazon's comprehensive device portfolio.

Key job responsibilities
Strategy & Partnership:
  • Drive upgrader strategy development and execution across multiple Product Linesand execute experimentation roadmaps
  • Build and maintain strong partnerships with Product Line leaders and key stakeholders
  • Identify opportunities to amplify Product Line initiatives through central upgrader capabilities
  • Create and maintain upgrader playbooks and best practices

Product Development Leadership:
  • Own product requirements gathering process and provide input to Product Management Teams on central upgrader capabilities
  • Collaborate with Product Management and Engineering teams to influence design and build of scalable solutions
  • Influence feature prioritization based on Product Line needs and business impact
  • Align Product Line requirements to product roadmaps

Cross-Functional Program Management:
  • Manage documentation and communication of upgrade programs
  • Manage and align upgrader pricing and promotion strategies
  • Partner with marketing teams on merchandising strategy
  • Track and report on program performance including goal updates and business reviews
  • Execute day-to-day operations required for delivering upgrades
  • Track progress against key upgrader goals

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

  • 7+ years of product or program management, product marketing, business development or technology experience
  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent
  • Experience with feature delivery and tradeoffs of a product
  • Experience owning/driving roadmap strategy and definition
  • Experience with end to end product delivery
  • Experience as a product manager or owner
  • Experience owning technology products

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • Experience in influencing senior leadership through data driven insights
  • Experience working across functional teams and senior stakeholders

title: Senior Product Manager - Tech, Amazon Devices Reverse Logistics
description:
DESCRIPTION

We are seeking an innovative Senior Product Manager - Tech to join the Amazon Devices Reverse Logistics (ADRL) team, focusing on Centralized Planning, Forecasting, and Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP). In this role, you will partner with the business and lead the development and implementation of technical solutions that optimize our reverse logistics operations, improve forecasting accuracy, and enhance operational efficiency across the ADRL ecosystem.

Key job responsibilities
  • Lead the development of product strategy and vision for ADRL's planning and forecasting systems
  • Define and execute the technical roadmap for S&OP tools and platforms
  • Develop detailed business requirements and user stories for forecasting models and planning systems
  • Drive cross-functional collaboration with engineering, operations, legal, tax, finance, and business teams
  • Manage prioritization and trade-offs between system performance, operational efficiency, and cost optimization
  • Create data-driven solutions to improve reverse logistics planning accuracy and operational effectiveness
  • Lead the development and launch of new tools and features for centralized planning systems
  • Partner with stakeholders to ensure alignment on priorities and resource allocation

About the team
ADRL's core function is to ensure Amazon Device customer warranty needs are met. We aim to delight consumer electronics customers worldwide by offering an OEM returns experience that delivers maximum margin recovery through flexible, world-class products & services.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

  • 7+ years of product or program management, product marketing, business development or technology experience
  • Bachelor's degree
  • Experience with feature delivery and tradeoffs of a product
  • Experience owning/driving roadmap strategy and definition
  • Experience with end to end product delivery
  • Experience contributing to engineering discussions around technology decisions and strategy related to a product
  • Experience managing technical products or online services
  • Experience in representing and advocating for a variety of critical customers and stakeholders during executive-level prioritization and planning
  • Master's degree, or a Bachelor's degree and experience with various machine learning techniques and parameters that affect their performance
  • Bachelor's degree in engineering, statistics or business, or a Bachelor's degree and experience delivering forecasting, budgeting, and variance analysis, and data interpretation of results

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • Experience in using analytical tools, such as Tableau, Qlikview, QuickSight
  • Experience in building and driving adoption of new tools
  • Experience performing statistical analysis of data using SQL, Excel and other tools

title: Principal PMT, Alexa - Echo Family Devices
description:
DESCRIPTION

Are you passionate about innovation and helping customers daily? Are you a data-driven product leader with experience launching disruptive software products?

Alexa AI team is developing innovative Generative-AI solutions to make Alexa a trusted assistant that helps customers daily.

As Principal Product Manager Tech for the Alexa AI team you will:

Define and drive customer-facing features for Alexa including advanced Conversational AI features with a high bar on responsible application of technology;
Create advanced features out of technical innovations
Drive clarity out of ambiguity, communicate a clear vision and align others to execute on your thoughtful requirements
Develop a deep understanding of customer needs and pain points
Work closely with science, engineering, UX/design, business development, legal, and internal and external partner organizations
Partner with other Amazon teams

Key job responsibilities
This is a horizontal product role spanning multiple delivery orgs in a functional product team. This team is central to delivery of an Generative AI-based service at a high quality bar. The right candidate will possess an understanding of engaging with science and engineering teams to deliver foundational technologies and customer experience at a high quality bar.

A day in the life
Cut through ambiguity, apply mechanisms, deliver requirements and engage deeply with science, engineering, feature, and UX teams to deliver bar raising customer experiences. Ultimately, you own the customer experience, with customer satisfaction as your ultimate success measure. You will engage with science and engineering teams daily, and update senior leadership on progress weekly. This is a high velocity, high ambiguity problem space, scrappiness and ability to drive teams with clarity will allow for success.

About the team
We are a functional team of product leaders (with some TPM, data science, and BI support) that spans critical areas of the Alexa product experience. We ensure our overall Alexa experience is consistently meeting a high customer bar.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

  • Experience with feature delivery and tradeoffs of a product
  • Experience owning/driving roadmap strategy and definition
  • Experience with end to end product delivery
  • Experience contributing to engineering discussions around technology decisions and strategy related to a product
  • Experience technical product management
  • 8+ years of technical product management, program management or engineering experience
  • Bachelor's degree in engineering or equivalent discipline, or 8+ years of product or program management, or technology experience

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • Experience leading cross-organizational programs and setting and holding teams and individuals to timelines and deliverables without explicit authority
  • Experience in project management methodologies, business analysis, or process improvement

title: Principal Product Manager - Tech, Prime Video & Amazon MGM Studios
description:
DESCRIPTION

Prime Video is a first-stop entertainment destination offering customers a vast collection of premium programming in one app available across thousands of devices. Prime members can customize their viewing experience and find their favorite movies, series, documentaries, and live sports – including Amazon MGM Studios-produced series and movies; licensed fan favorites; and programming from Prime Video add-on subscriptions such as Apple TV+, Max, Crunchyroll and MGM+. All customers, regardless of whether they have a Prime membership or not, can rent or buy titles via the Prime Video Store, and can enjoy even more content for free with ads.

Are you interested in shaping the future of entertainment? Prime Video's technology teams are creating best-in-class digital video experience.

As a Prime Video technologist, you’ll have end-to-end ownership of the product, user experience, design, and technology required to deliver state-of-the-art experiences for our customers. You’ll get to work on projects that are fast-paced, challenging, and varied. You’ll also be able to experiment with new possibilities, take risks, and collaborate with remarkable people.

We’ll look for you to bring your diverse perspectives, ideas, and skill-sets to make Prime Video even better for our customers. With global opportunities for talented technologists, you can decide where a career Prime Video Tech takes you!

Shape the future of cinematic storytelling: for creators, by creators. We’re seeking a founding Principal Product Manager – Tech to reimagine how premium live-action, VFX, and animation content is made with breakthrough multimodal AI. At Prime Video and Amazon MGM Studios, you’ll lead product strategy for a next-generation production toolkit that puts AI superpowers directly in the hands of content creators.

You’ll define product vision and E2E workflows for an AI-powered creative suite that blends art and science, uniting pre-production, virtual production, VFX, editorial, audio, localization, and real-time iteration in a unified workspace that amplifies, not replaces, human creativity. You'll focus on our Live Action/VFX customer experience, while partnering closely with our Animation leads to ensure shared platform capabilities, consistent interaction patterns, and cross-pipeline interoperability. You’ll partner directly with engineering, science, creative teams, and studio leaders to set new standards for AI-assisted production and establish the product culture from the ground up. You will:

  • Act as a founding PM-T with high ownership and transformational impact
  • Think systems-first across complex, collaborative studio pipelines (from previs to final pixels) for both live-action/VFX and animation
  • Define product patterns and scale platform capabilities for global, multi-user production use cases
  • Operate from first principles; raise the bar for craft, simplicity, safety, and creator delight

Key job responsibilities
This isn’t just another PM role, it’s your chance to define an entirely new category of creative tools. You’ll lead product strategy for an AI-powered platform that transforms how teams bring stories to life. More on what you’ll do:
  • Own end-to-end product strategy for AI-assisted workflows from previs to production to post.
  • Translate emerging model capabilities into shippable features that creators love.
  • Define interoperability with DCCs and review/handoff primitives that fit real studio pipelines.
  • Champion safety and IP provenance: content controls, auditability, model/version traceability, data governance, and IP-respecting defaults.
  • Run creator-in-the-loop validation: recruit filmmakers/VFX supervisors/animation leads, design pilots, and turn qualitative insights and production data into roadmap decisions.
  • Build PR/FAQs, tenets, and success metrics; drive specs through delivery/QA with Engineering and Science; iterate quickly toward measurable time-to-screen and cost improvements.
  • Communicate at the right altitude, from detailed product reviews to executive narratives and live demos.
  • Partner with Studio Ops, Production Technology, and Content leaders to align requirements, milestones, and slate needs; influence cross-team roadmaps.
  • Raise the bar on product craft and team culture; mentor PMs and help recruit a diverse, creator-obsessed team.

A day in the life
A typical day starts with a cross-functional sync (Eng, Science, UX, Studio Ops) to unblock releases and review shot-to-shot consistency. You hop into a pilot with a VFX supervisor to test video-to-video transforms and motion fidelity, then meet an animation lead to confirm asset-consistency services also support character shots. After lunch, you co-spec DCChandoffs for previs-to-on-set, and adjust roadmap priorities. You review creator feedback, clarify acceptance criteria with engineering, and prep an exec-level demo. You wrap by updating success metrics, and pilot plans for tomorrow’s build.

About the team
We’re a small, high-ownership “startup within Amazon,” formed by Prime Video and Amazon MGM Studios to invent a unified, AI-powered creative toolkit that accelerates how premium content gets made. Our mission is to empower creators with tools that are powerfully capable yet delightfully simple, preserving creative control while unlocking new velocity through AI. We operate from first principles, learn directly from working creators, and hold a high bar for craft, safety, and storytelling magic. If you’re motivated by invention and inspired by storytellers, this is your seat at the table.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

  • 8+ years of technical product or program management experience
  • 2+ years of end to end product delivery experience
  • Bachelor's degree
  • Experience with feature delivery and tradeoffs of a product
  • Experience owning/driving roadmap strategy and definition
  • Experience leading engineering discussions around technology decisions and strategy related to a product
  • Experience technical product management

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • Experience working directly with Engineers on product enhancements
  • Experience in project management methodologies, business analysis, or process improvement
  • Experience developing, deploying and managing AI products at scale
  • 8+ years of VFX environment experience
